resources.string: Puerto Berrío is located in a region of Antioquia known as the Middle Magdalena (near the Magdalena River). It is bounded on the north by the municipalities of Yolombó, Remedios and Yondó, on the east by the department of Santander, on the south by the municipalities of Puerto Nare and Caracolí, and on the west by the municipalities of Caracolí and Maceo. It is some 191 km away from the city of Medellín, capital of Antioquia. The municipality has an extension of 1,184 km²
Confort and services in a hotel
Iglesia Nuestra Señora de los Dolores
Mother´s pain feeling at the suffering of a child
Connect Antioquia and Santander, like Ferrocarril de Antioquia And Ferrocarril del Atlántico
Total population: 46 883 people in 2005 Urban population: 42 084, Rural population: 4 799, Literacy: 85.8, Urban zone: 87.3, Rural zone: 75.0

The name of the city was given July 15, 1875, a few months after the death of Dr. Pedro Justo Berrio Rojas, President of the State of Antioquia by Decree 34 of 1875, it has the fourth article, setting the name "Puerto Berrio", which took effect from the first of September 1875 onwards.
Made by Joan Esteban Chacón Quintero
